page.title: 08Customs: Mayday
page.content: Our Mayday was very special this year because it was the eightieth time it had been held. Many past May_queens tried to come to this Mayday. The festivities started with a parade round the village green. The queen and her attendants were on the may_cart and the local band were leading. There were many stalls and some amusements for children. The village children en- joyed dancing round the maypole and there was a very good fancy-dress competition. A display of dancing was given by majorettes. A delicious tea was provided and afterwards the foot- ball and netball teams played their matches. The winning teams recieved trophies for their work. A dance was held in the village hall and every- one enjoyed it.A special effort had been made to ensure that gardens and village greens were tidy..
